event.description: {CovLStrv2{The instance of `JwtConsumerBuilder` ignores the expiration time by default, unless the `setRequireExpirationTime()` function is called explicitly. Ignoring the expiration time for a JSON web token means it is valid forever. Since the token never expires, an attacker has a longer window to brute-force or exploit the stolen token.}}

{CovLStrv2{Verify that the token is still valid by invoking the `setRequireExpirationTime()` function. Invoke the `setMaxFutureValidityInMinutes()` function if you need to tolerate a small amount of clock skew.}}
